channel.title: [help]Connecting to own server
channel.description:
I port forwarded to 43594 with TCP and I port forwarded it to my default gateway(192.168.1.1). I signed up on no-ip and I have it on and it's checked. I opened port 43594 on my firewall. My client is on my no-ip and uses port 43594. My server is running.
I tried it, and I get Error connecting to server but I did everything. It works fine with the IP 127.0.0.1, but I want my server the be public. Help??
EDIT: I fixed my CLASSPATH/PATH and rebooted but it still didn't work.
EDIT2: I tried it on Hamachi and it worked perfectly fine, so I'm guessing there's an error with my port forwarding.
EDIT3: I port forwarded with UCP and TCP and changed it to my internal IP.
EDIT4: I went to my no-ip with my browser(FireFox), and it went to my router page.

item.title: [help]Connecting to own server

@nozirev wrote:

Dude same as me wtf is the problem

Read full topic

It says cannot establish connection. (using my external ip)

Read full topic

item.title: [help]Connecting to own server
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

Yeah I noticed it and didn’t bother removing… Go to http://yourip:43594 , does it bring up router prompt, or connecting to _ ?

Read full topic

item.title: [help]Connecting to own server
item.dc:creator: @Rigged Rigged
item.description:
@Rigged wrote:

[quote=“Hidendra, post:2, topic:223893”]Port forward to YOUR computer’s ip, not default gateway lulz (ip address is usually the right one, in run->cmd [ ipconfig ].
When in doubt, your local ip is 192.168.1.x where x is 2 or higher.

@edit4: did you go to: yournoip.no-ip.tld:43594 or without 43594?[/quote]
If you saw EDIT3, I said internal IP which is technically the same as your computer IP. I went to it without the 43594.

Read full topic

item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

Port forward to YOUR computer’s ip, not default gateway lulz (ip address is usually the right one, in run->cmd [ ipconfig ].
When in doubt, your local ip is 192.168.1.x where x is 2 or higher.

@edit4: did you go to: yournoip.no-ip.tld:43594 or without 43594?

Read full topic

item.title: [help]Connecting to own server
item.dc:creator: @Rigged Rigged
item.description:
@Rigged wrote:

I port forwarded to 43594 with TCP and I port forwarded it to my default gateway(192.168.1.1).
I signed up on no-ip and I have it on and it’s checked.
I opened port 43594 on my firewall.
My client is on my no-ip and uses port 43594.
My server is running.

I tried it, and I get Error connecting to server but I did everything. It works fine with the IP 127.0.0.1, but I want my server the be public. Help??

EDIT: I fixed my CLASSPATH/PATH and rebooted but it still didn’t work.

EDIT2: I tried it on Hamachi and it worked perfectly fine, so I’m guessing there’s an error with my port forwarding.

EDIT3: I port forwarded with UCP and TCP and changed it to my internal IP.

EDIT4: I went to my no-ip with my browser(FireFox), and it went to my router page.
